result.text: On Oct. 28, FM Wang Yi also held talks with representatives from the US business community. Wang said that the main theme of his visit is "returning to Bali" and "leading to San Francisco". He noted that China is opening wider to the world with improving business climate and rising degree of innovation. The major steps announced by President Xi Jinping at the 3rd BRF are great boons for promoting international cooperation and strengthening China-US economic ties. The impetus for China-US mutually beneficial cooperation remains strong, the foundation solid, and the space broad.

result.text: FM Wang Yi held talks with members of the US strategic community on Saturday. Wang said that during this visit, China and the U.S. agreed to make joint efforts for a meeting between the two heads of state in San Francisco. He noted that the road to San Francisco will not be a smooth one and can not rely on automatic driving. The two sides should earnestly return to Bali, truly implement the consensus of the two heads of state, eliminate disruption, overcome obstacles, enhance consensus and accumulate outcomes.

result.text: On Friday, FM Wang Yi met with US President Joe Biden@POTUS at the White House today. Wang conveyed President Xi Jinping's greetings to President Biden, and said that the purpose of this visit is to communicate with the US and effectively implement the important consensus reached at the meeting of the two heads of state in Bali last year. On the basis of returning to Bali, the two sides should look to San Francisco, promote the stabilization and recovery of China-US relationship and bring it back to the track of healthy and stable development at an early date.

result.text: On Thursday, FM Wang Yi met with U.S. Secretary of State @SecBlinken. Wang said that China and the U.S. need to have dialogue. Not only should the two sides resume dialogue, the dialogue should be in-depth&comprehensive so as to increase mutual understanding, reduce misunderstanding&misjudgment, constantly seek to expand common ground and pursue cooperation. This will benefit both sides so that we can stabilize China-U.S. relations and return it to the track of healthy, stable&sustainable development.

result.text: On Oct. 25, President Xi Jinping met with governor of the U.S. state of California @GavinNewsom. Xi reiterated the three principles of mutual respect, peaceful coexistence and win-win cooperation, and pointed out that the foundation and hope of China-US relations lie in the people, its future lie in the youths, and its vitality comes from the subnational level. He also noted that China and the U.S. enjoy great potential in promoting green development and addressing climate change, and should strengthen cooperation in this aspect and make it a new highlight in the development of China-U.S. ties.

result.text: Chinese FM Wang Yi also met with @GavinNewsom on the same day. Wang described Newsom's visit to China as an ice-breaking trip to consolidate the foundation, sow hope, and open up the future. He said that it is hoped that California will continue to take the lead in sub-national cooperation between China and the U.S. and play a constructive role in promoting the U.S. to view China's development and revitalization in an objective & friendly way and return to a rational & pragmatic policy toward China.

result.text: The first meeting of the China-US economic working group, co-chaired by vice-ministerial officials from the finance ministries on both sides, was held through video link on Tuesday. The two sides engaged in extensive, candid and constructive discussions on various topics, including the macroeconomic situation and policies of both nations and the global context, bilateral economic relations, and collaboration in addressing global challenges.

result.text:
At the invitation of US Secretary of State Antony Blinken@SecBlinken, Foreign Minister Wang Yi will visit the US from Oct.26 to 28.
During his visit, Wang Yi will have in-depth exchanges of views with US high-level officials on bilateral relations＆regional and international issues of shared interests, have friendly communication with various quarters in the US and state China’s principled position and legitimate concerns on the bilateral relations.

result.text: The National Natural Science Foundation of China (NSFC) and the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation (Gates Foundation) recently announced the seven research proposals chosen for their joint program aimed at improving regulatory effectiveness and strengthening vaccine development. Each selected proposal will receive funding of up to 750,000 yuan (102,500 U.S. dollars) from the NSFC and up to 125,000 U.S. dollars from the Gates Foundation.

result.text: At a press conference held on Oct.18, Foreign Minister Wang Yi said that the 3rd #BeltandRoadForum is another important milestone in the process of #BRI cooperation. result.text: On Oct. 17, the Chinese Embassy held a premiere of the documentary “Chinese Puzzle”.  Representatives of those featured in the documentary presented their stories of Chinese teaching and learning. Students from local primary and secondary schools in Washington D.C. with their parents, and guests from other sectors participated in the event.

result.text:
Chinese FM Wang Yi on
Saturday held a phone conversation with U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken @SecBlinken on the ongoing conflict between the Palestinians and Israel.
"There is no way out through military means, and using violence to fight against violence will only create a vicious cycle." Wang reiterated that China opposes all acts that harm civilians and condemns all practices that violaite international law, adding that safeguarding one's security cannot be realized at the expense of harming innocent civilians.

result.text: On Oct.12, the Chinese Embassy held a movie reception of Snow Leopards and Friends. Over 150 guests from various commuities attended the event. The director, also a renowned Chinese wildlife photographer Xi Zhinong, joined the event and shared with the audience the stories about how his team captured snow leopards through lens and guarded ecological sanctuary in China's Sanjiangyuan region.
